TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit AuthenticatedConnection extends Microsoft.Health.ApplicationConnection

Docs.summary: Represents an authenticated interface to the HealthVault service. Most operations performed against the service require authentication.
Docs.remarks:
You must connect to the HealthVault service to access its web methods. This class does not maintain an open connection to the service, but uses XML over HTTP to make requests and receive responses from the service. The connection only maintains the data necessary for the request.
An authenticated connection takes the user name and password, authenticates them against the HealthVault service, and then stores an authentication token which is then passed to the service on each subsequent request. An authenticated connection is required for accessing a person's health record.
For operations that do not require user or application authentication, use the class.

MemberSignature.Value: public void Authenticate ();
.method public hidebysig instance void Authenticate() cil managed

Docs.summary: Logs on to the HealthVault service using the username and password.
Docs.remarks: It is not necessary to explicitly call this method before calling any of the methods that access the service. Those methods will call this method if the user has not already been authenticated. This method is provided as a convenience to allow for separate error handling for authorization errors.
Docs.exception: The caller does not have permission to connect to the requested URI or a URI to which the request is redirected.
The authorization URL specified to the constructor is not a valid URI.
The authorization was not returned in the response from the server.

MemberSignature.Value: public void Impersonate (Guid targetPersonId);
.method public hidebysig instance void Impersonate(valuetype System.Guid targetPersonId) cil managed

Docs.param: The unique identifier for the person to impersonate.
Docs.summary: Sets the identifier for the person being impersonated.
Docs.remarks:
Impersonation occurs when the authenticated person wants to make a request to the HealthVault service on behalf of another person. This should not occur in most applications.
The authenticated person must have the rights to call the requested method for the person being impersonated. If that right exists, all security processing occurs using the impersonated person's identity. If the right does not exist, the caller receives an upon the first invocation of a method that accesses the HealthVault service.
To start impersonating, call the method. To stop impersonating, call the method.
Docs.exception: The parameter is Guid.Empty.

MemberSignature.Value: public bool IsImpersonating { get; }
.property instance bool IsImpersonating

Docs.summary: Gets the value which states whether or not the current connection is impersonating a different user than who is authenticated.
Docs.value: true if has been called with a valid target person identifier and has not been called; otherwise, false.

If that right exists, all security processing occurs using the impersonated person's identity. If the right does not exist, the caller receives a upon the first invocation of a method that accesses the HealthVault service.
To start impersonating, call the method. To stop impersonating, call the method.

MemberSignature.Value: public static Microsoft.Health.AuthenticatedConnection LogOn (string liveIdTicket, bool isMra, bool isPersistent, System.Threading.ManualResetEvent cancelTrigger, Guid applicationId, Uri shellUrl, Uri healthServiceUrl);

.method public static hidebysig class Microsoft.Health.AuthenticatedConnection LogOn(string liveIdTicket, bool isMra, bool isPersistent, class System.Threading.ManualResetEvent cancelTrigger, valuetype System.Guid applicationId, class System.Uri shellUrl, class System.Uri healthServiceUrl) cil managed

Docs.param: A Live ID ticket that was retrieved using the IDCRL.

True if the application is a multi-record application, or false otherwise. Multi-record applications can work with many user records at one time and does not rely on the selected record when performing operations.

True if creating a persistent token, or false otherwise. Persistent connections remain valid for the duration specified in the application's configuration within HealthVault. Typically, persistent tokens are valid for up to one year.
If the event gets triggered the log on request will be cancelled resulting in an .
The unique HealthVault application identifier that the user is being logged into.
The HealthVault Shell redirector URL. This is used to to verify the Live ID ticket before authenticating the user to HealthVault.
The URL of the HealthVault service. Note, this must include the web service handler, "wildcat.ashx".

If the request to the HealthVault Shell to verify the fails.
If the user specified in the could not be authenticated to HealthVault.

MemberSignature.Value: public void StopImpersonating ();
.method public hidebysig instance void StopImpersonating() cil managed

Docs.summary: Unsets the target person identifier for all requests.
Docs.remarks:
All future requests will act as the authenticated person.
Note, to change the person that is being impersonated, StopImpersonating does not have to be called. can be called directly with a new target person identifier.
Impersonation occurs when the authenticated person wants to make a request to the HealthVault service on behalf of another person. This should not occur in most applications.
The authenticated person must have the rights to call the requested method for the person being impersonated. If that right exists, all security processing occurs using the impersonated person's identity. If the right does not exist, the caller receives a upon the first invocation of a method that accesses the HealthVault service.
To start impersonating, call the method. To stop impersonating, call the method.
